instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message: Hi I have another one of these. I’m getting 3 beeps.  Fan is spinning and I checked <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> enable signals and output at L7330 on pin 2 I have 1.5v. With no ram present it beeps once every second with ram installed it beeps 3 times. I tried 3 different modules. So I need some help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message:
Use DDR3 test card and follow bad contacts indicated.
See if you can solve that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message: I did the one you told me to order. All lights illuminated. There like 5-6 leds that are brighter than others. :/ I also ordered a t866ii programmer to try a new clean bios. Do you know where I can find Both Versions? these boards can from a repair shop and aren’t in good shape :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message:
3 beeps point to RAM issue always.
There are probably some power lines, not connected to LEDs on test card.
Check the solders near the edge of RAM slots.

The brighter LEDs patron must be always the same.

Try this file, just in case...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-E01-NpQ0hiF-xU6MRyRIgeXAtxKyVzk/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message:
Thank you. You are always a great help :) I recurved the programmer on Monday-Wednesday I’ll let you know how it goes 
Thanks once again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message: Well I got the programmer and well 2 things I don’t know how to use it :/ and another bios does with the same numerations Also had 3 beeps :/ I guess it time to check all the power lines again :( if you come up with anything let me know I’ll be tracing from the ram to see what’s going on and out :/

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message: I checked them they’re all good. But I’ll go over them again. I also checked each pin individually for connection to ram. May I ask you can a question? I see their are several phases of the cpu is it at all possible that it not passing the data integrity because the cpu isn’t at the proper state for checking data integrity? I’m sorry if this sounds ridiculous. Also is there a reset signal that might be suspending the cpu or like a sleep state ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message:
If you get error beeps, CPU is up and running.
But it encounters a communication problem with RAM modules.
Check DDRVTT voltage also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message:
Ok I went over all the voltages and they all where present. What I did find was <SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is 1.4v on <TRANSISTOR>Q3220</TRANSISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R1120</RESISTOR> pin2 its also 1.4v I was thinking it was low but being that it’s also going to the <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> maybe It isn’t. <SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD_L</SIGNAL> is .560mv  So by the voltage divider it should be .800mv. since it’s being pulled low i believe it’s Still working ok and it’s passing <SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD</SIGNAL> but is 1.4v The correct voltage for this rail?
Are these voltages correct?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps Swapped ram and used top/bottom slots
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1120</RESISTOR> pulls-high <SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD</SIGNAL> to 1.5V so the voltage is correct there.

"So by the voltage divider it should be .800mv"
I suppose you are talking about <SIGNAL>P1V5_S0_DIV</SIGNAL>; it enables <TRANSISTOR>Q3220</TRANSISTOR> which pulls-down <SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD_L</SIGNAL>.
All that circuit is OK there...
